games_fictional: Mario Kart VR, a virtual reality version of the classic Mario Kart
Tetris VR, a virtual reality version of the classic Tetris
Grant's escape adventure where players command a fleet of interstellar ships in a galaxy-wide war, managing resources and diplomacy while engaging in epic space battles
Retro911 to the rescue, a game where in a world locked in eternal time travel, players must build and defend their retro gaming systems while battling other factions and surviving the elements
AmigaTales, a farming simulator with a dark twistâ€”raise crops in a haunted land where ghosts and monsters roam, using magic to protect your farm
Frank and the wombats, a sci-fi RPG where players travel across planets to awaken ancient alien machines, unlocking forgotten technology to stop a galactic war
Sir Cedric of the East Village Sim, a dungeon-crawling RPG where players delve into the body of a colossal, fallen god, fighting through its corrupted organs for treasure
Taylor's Cat hoarding sim, a real-time strategy game where players manipulate time to control armies of cats from different eras
Legare's university 2k25, a multiplayer brawler where fighters control elemental vortexes, combining them in creative ways to dominate opponents in chaotic arenas
Street Taco Bonanza, a tactical card game where players cast spells, summon creatures, and manipulate time using ancient rune magic to outwit their opponents in a mystical realm
Flipping Waffles, a competitive cooking adventure, players travel through enchanted lands, flipping waffles and mastering magical recipes to win culinary duels against mythical creatures
Best Chronicles, an action RPG where you play as a shapeshifting warrior in a world dominated by wild, mythical creatures, battling to protect your tribe and unlock your full animal forms
Cyberduck where players soar through floating islands in an open-world adventure, controlling wind currents to solve puzzles and defeat cyber pirates
Escape from Broadcom, a ninja stealth game set in a futuristic dystopia where players use high-tech swords and cloaking abilities to take down Broadcom tyrants
Ridge rager where racers across alternate dimensions in anti-gravity vehicles bend the laws of physics and compete for the ultimate championship
gaming_systems_fictional: Cat9600, a vibrant console with 8-bit processor and 64KB RAM that boasts classic joystick controls and a library of pixelated platformers and retro RPGs, all rendered in bright colors
Intellico, a compact system with a 32-bit CPU, 16MB RAM, and unique 3D mode using cartridges to deliver low-poly graphics and catchy chiptunes, making it ideal for immersive 3D adventures
Switchblade, a cube-shaped console powered by a 16-bit processor and 128KB RAM, offering two-player capabilities and a diverse library of quirky puzzle games and arcade hits with stunning sprite art
GraniteTastic, a gaming console that incorporates holographic projection technology and runs on a custom 32-bit chip with 256MB RAM, allowing players to explore classic 2D games in 360 degrees
iGameLab, a mini gaming console featuring an 8-bit CPU, 32KB RAM, and revives the charm of retro gaming with 8-bit soundtracks and a lineup of beloved platformers
16bitClaw, a handheld gaming device with a 2.5-inch LCD screen, powered by a 16-bit processor and 1MB RAM, allowing on-the-go gaming with side-scrolling adventures and vibrant pixel art graphics
TheClaw, a home console featuring a 40MHz CPU and 512KB RAM, allowing connection to arcade cabinets with classic game emulations and multiplayer tournaments for a true arcade experience at home

pipinstaller, an early-90s style console featuring a 16-bit processor and 1MB RAM, offering a library of fast-paced racing and sports games, complete with a unique turbo button for an adrenaline boost
genConsole, a sleek black console powered by a 32-bit processor and 128MB RAM, utilizing laser technology for quick load times and offering classic sci-fi shooters and futuristic racing games
Force5, a portable gaming system resembling a classic book, featuring a 4.5-inch E Ink display, powered by a 16-bit processor and 256KB RAM, ideal for text-based adventures and visual novels
NinjaX, a networked console features a 32-bit CPU, 512KB RAM, and allows players to connect their systems for cooperative gameplay, focusing on action-adventure titles with fantasy themes
Neo X, designed for speed, this console features a 16-bit processor with a super turbo chip, providing enhanced graphics and sound for fast-paced action games
Magneto OdX, a retro console with a 32-bit audio processor and 1MB RAM, combining gaming with music through rhythm-based games allowing players to groove while they compete
TinTin 2000, This oversized console features a 128-bit CPU and 1GB RAM, offering a unique collection of quirky simulation games that capture the whimsy of 80s pop culture in stunning detail

DynoVision, With a sleek silver design, this console features a 32-bit processor and 256KB RAM, focusing on nostalgia with remakes of classic games, enhancing graphics and sound while retaining original charm
